page.title: 11WILDLIFE : ANIMALS
page.content: {SMALL MAMMALS }The small mammals in the glen are moles, common shrew, bank and field vole, wood mouse, house mouse, common rat and hedgehog. {PESTS }are: Foxes, because they take the hens and lambs, rabbits because they eat the vegetables, flowers and grain and stoats because they steal the eggs and chickens. {RED SQUIRRELS}are fairly common. They scamper across the drive and we see a lot of them. Squirrels store beechnuts and pine seeds. They sleep on a pile of moss beside their store of food. {UNUSUAL ANIMALS }in the glen are mink, which may be increasing, otter which lives in the Prosen Water and wild cat which may be only 50% wild because they crossbreed with feral cats. Pipistrelle bats hibernate in the attic of the school.
